section.content: Optimal Use of the Unlimited Marital Deduction A graduate of Vanderbilt University and the Kellogg Graduate School of Management, Rick Tyler is the former Chief Fiduciary Executive for Barnett Banks Trust Company. A frequent speaker, his comments draw upon over 20 years of experience in the Financial Services industry. Presented by Rick Tyler

Upon the first death, it may be less than optimal to apply the unlimited marital deduction to 100% of the estate: It increases the size and potential tax exposure of the survivorâ€™s estate. Forfeit the Applicable Credit in the first estate. 1. Utilize the Applicable Credit to exclude as much as possible from taxation. 2. Apply the marital deduction to the balance to defer taxes until the second death. Optimal Use of the Unlimited Marital Deduction
